item.title: Voluptuous Disintegration: A Future History of Black Computational Thought
item.author: Romi Ron Morrison
item.description: Sucked by the tongue and the lips while the teeth release the succulence of all voluptuous disintegration I am turning under the trees I am trailing blood into the rivers I am walking loud along the streets I am digging my nails and my heels into the land I am opening my mouth I am just about to touch the pomegranates piled up precarious This is a good time
